1433539298100404227.text: H.R.2609, The Naval Readiness Act: Provides oversight over U.S. Navy vessels by making permanent the requirement for an annual report on the material condition of Navy ships, expanding this report to make it more meaningful for both the taxpayer and Congress alike.

1433539186213142531.text: H.R.5108, The 1st Lt. Hugh Conor McDowell Safety in Armed Forces Equipment Act of 2021: Explores the incorporation of blackboxes in tactical vehicles, allowing data collection on prospective safety improvements for our servicemembers.

1433539122132619269.text: H.R. 5147, Prohibiting the Secretary of Defense from procuring personal protective equipment from certain non-allied foreign nations, and for other purposes.

1433539017514135556.text: H.R.4935, SWOLE Act (Amended): Improves the retention of Surface Warfare Officers (SWO) by investigating root causes to female retention shortfalls, and increases the marketability of SWOs by credentialing them as mariners: a win-win for the Navy and the Merchant Marines alike.

1433538898982998017.text: H.R.4987, The Global Force Management Oversight Act: Requires an annual report on the Global Force Management Allocation Plan (GFMAP) and briefing on major changes to the GFMAP throughout the year. This  makes sure our tax-payer dollars reflect the priorities of the NDS.

1433538896944586761.text: H.R.4861, The COBIA Act: Ensures schools educating service-connected children receive the full sum of federal impact aid to which they are currently entitled. A big win for school districts near military installations.

1433538895573045254.text: H.R.5104, The Just In Case Act: Establishes Special Emergency Reimbursement Authority for the Dept of Defense, similar to that provided by Sec. 3610 of the CARES Act, to allow contractors be reimbursed if they are unable to work on-site due to a pandemic.

1278340515243724800.text: (2/2) I remain hopeful for a continued bipartisan process for the #FY21NDAA.

1278340514480259077.text: (1/2) Pleased to announce that the SPF provisions in the #FY21NDAA have passed, including several measures that I championed for our warfighters and those that support them around our nation and the globe. #FY21NDAA

1278338811563556867.text: (8/8) We should all be reminded about the purpose of our quest is to pass a bipartisan mark that can overcome forces that seek to weaken our national security and our nation’s resolve. #FY21NDAA

1278338701916098560.text: (7/ ) I am reminded of a quote: “The Quest stands upon the edge of a knife. Stray but a little, and it will fail, to the ruin of all. Yet hope remains while the Company is true.” #FY21NDAA

1278338628368941056.text: (6/ ) This Seapower mark, and as I reviewed the chairman’s mark, are worth supporting. But I am also cautious as we continue to review amendments for our consideration that are very divisive. #FY21NDAA

1278338536903770112.text: (5/ ) Finally, this mark is about oversight. We curtail the KC-46A, an aircraft that is replete with deficiencies, ... and we limit the procurement of large unmanned surface vessels until basic unmanned concepts are demonstrated.

1278338412815224832.text: (4/ ) We seek to address concerns surrounding sealift and airlift by authorizing the purchase of 4 used sealift vessels, the authorization of a Tanker Security Program and the establishment of a C-130 aircraft force structure floor.

1278338323514306560.text: (3/ ) Preeminent in this mark is the inclusion of an attack submarine, the #1 Unfunded Request by @CNO. We also include critical capabilities to expand undersea strike with 6 P-8 Poseidon aircraft and advancing a future attack submarine design.

1278338247740047360.text: (2/ ) This mark seeks to rapidly expand unique, asymmetric advantages the US maintains over peers and seeks to impose a cost imposition strategy with these investments. #FY21NDAA

1235339573644996609.text: As a former public health official, I know the critical role our public officials play in combating potential epidemics. I’m glad we were able to come together to get this emergency supplemental passed and hope my colleagues in the Senate are soon to follow.

1235339572910923776.text: This bill provides important funding that allows the Administration to address the virus at home and abroad, including expediting vaccine development, purchasing essential equipment and supplies, and assisting state and local health departments.

1235339572256612352.text: Today I voted to approve over $7 billion in emergency funding for the U.S. response to the Coronavirus as well as extending emergency telehealth services. This legislation is the product of a bipartisan compromise to address this emergency.

1235274303400116230.text: We’ve made a significant amount of process, but we’ve got more work to do. Together we will continue to clean up the Chesapeake Bay by ensuring critical federal funding and extending key programs that benefit the watershed.

1235274302540435456.text: I have been working across the aisle to advance key Bay initiatives like the Chesapeake Bay Program Reauthorization Act, Chesapeake Bay Gateways and Watertrails Network Reauthorization Act, Chesapeake Bay Science, Education, and Ecosystem Enhancement Act, and Chesapeake WILD Act.

1235274300552335360.text: Today, I spoke at the @ChooseCleanH2O eighth annual Chesapeake Bay Day about my efforts in Congress to clean up the Bay. As one of the Co-Chairs of the Congressional Chesapeake Bay Watershed Caucus, this is one of my top priorities in Congress. https://t.co/DvuhFojh6k

1235219557805166593.text: There are ongoing discussions about who should be funding Surge Sealift Recapitalization, whether it should be Army or the Navy, but we cannot keep putting it on the backburner #McAleese

1235219556441915395.text: We must also prioritize Sealift Recapitalization. The readiness goal is to have an 85% availability rate to support large-scale force deployments. …Our availability rate? 40.7%. How can we expect our soldiers to fight if they cannot get to the fight? #McAleese

1235219555259211780.text: Navy’s FY21 plan takes a step back by requesting 8 ships in FY21 and even includes, accelerated, unanticipated ship retirement. This is not how I believe we can get to a #355ships by 2030.

1235219554407780358.text: For us, in Congress working on the NDAA, this means one simple thing: Make the dollar work harder than the Yuan and the Ruble. #McAleese

1235219171769712641.text: Honored to speak today at the #McAleese 11th Annual Conference today about the FY21 Defense Budget and FY21 NDAA. https://t.co/ogTRCkADHb

1234949178998034432.text: Internet is necessary to participate in the modern economy, but 600k Virginians still lack access to adequate broadband. Today the House passed S. 1822 which includes the Broadband DATA Act & MAPS Act, which I cosponsored. These bills will improve connectivity across VA. https://t.co/5u5dW3HTyx

1234558593036361730.text:
Proud to support measures last week to help veterans and their families to provide resources they deserve:

✅ Gold Star Spouses and Spouses of Injured Servicemembers Leasing Relief Expansion Act
✅ GIVE Act
✅ Legal Services for Homeless Veterans Act

I will always support vets.

1233166584493023232.text: We need an updated 30-Year Shipbuilding Plan, not this summer, but now. We are at a critical point for rebuilding our Fleet – and I refuse to let our @USNavy lose capacity.

1233166583499042816.text: I’m also concerned about the entire Columbia-class ballistic missile submarine coming from the Navy budget. This is a critical strategic asset that is vital to our nuclear deterrence and this behemoth of a bill should not be borne by the Navy alone.

1233166582316138504.text: After receiving the Navy’s Budget for FY2021, I'm deeply concerned that we have shifted off the path necessary to reach a #355ship Navy. The shipbuilding account is wholly inadequate to meet our strategic demands. A #355ship Navy is not just a goal, it's the law.

994233347114139648.text: Overall, the Chairman’s mark better addresses our future readiness challenges. It accelerates the 355-ship navy and the expected projection forces our nation so desperately needs.  #FY19NDAA

994233345910411264.text: In brief, we authorized the 4th Ford-class Aircraft carrier, expanded procurement of the Littoral Combat Ship, and made critical investments toward two additional attack submarines in fiscal years 2022 and 2023.  #FY19NDAA

994233345063247877.text: Because of these tough choices and a commitment to be good stewards of the taxpayers’ dollar, we were able to accelerate major Seapower and Projection Forces equities.  #FY19NDAA

994233343997894657.text: To this end, our Seapower and Projection Forces mark sought and achieved a balance of current and future readiness. #FY19NDAA

994233342966018049.text: As the former Readiness Subcommittee Chairman, I'm painfully aware that readiness is composed of two major components: current readiness and future readiness. Without an adequate balance between the two, we cannot hope to be successful in the future of armed conflict.  #FY19NDAA
